# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
$a=$Host.UI.RawUI.WindowSize.Width-3
$b='dyidydyjfykfyj'
$c=$a-$b.length
$a..$c|%{
[PScustomobject]@{
aafvhsfheth=' '*$_
$b='test'
}|out-host}
```

# Expected behavior

```none
aafvhsfheth                                                      d                                                                  y
                                                                 i                                                                  d                                                                  y                                                                  d                                                                  y                                                                  j                                                                  f                                                                  y
                                                                 k
                                                                  f
                                                                  y
                                                                  j
 -----------                                                      -
                                                                  t
                                                                  e
                                                                  s
                                                                  t
```

# Actual behavior

```none
aafvhsfheth
 -----------
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
7,6,5.1
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: @he852100 can you explain what exactly you're trying to accomplish here? This is definitely an edge case for the formatter, and I'm not sure I see a lot of value in forcing it to show each _character_ on a new line in the vast majority of cases. 🙂

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
@he852100, _implicit_ formatting _never_ automatically line-wraps _values_ (only _column headers_), only piping to `Format-Table -Wrap` does.

There is a small bug in the formatter, however: with only _one_ character to show, it should show the ellipsis (`…`), not the first character of the value:

```powershell
PS> [pscustomobject] @{  ('a' *([console]::WindowWidth - 3)) = 'abc'; 'b' = 'def' }
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa b
----------------------------------------------------------------------------- -
abc                                                                           d
```

That is, instead of `d` you should see `…` in the above output.
